definition: to hesitate to move forward/to hesitate/to hold back
to pace back and forth/to hesitate/to waver
to hesitate
(negative prefix)/not/no
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: The complexity of hukou reform daunts Chinese leaders.
sentences.chinese: 户籍改革的艰巨和复杂性让政府踌躇不前。

sentences.english: He doesn’t hesitate to enter the ur anymore.
sentences.chinese: 他不再对乌尔地区踌躇不前。

sentences.english: I hesitated to move ahead, feeling perplexed and melancholy.
sentences.chinese: 我踌躇不前，不由感到一阵迷惑和惆怅。

sentences.english: The step of his strength shall be straitened, and his own counsel shall cast him down headlong.
sentences.chinese: 他强健的脚步要踌躇不前，他的计谋必使自己颠仆。

sentences.english: His vigorous steps weaken ; his own schemes make him stumble.
sentences.chinese: 他强健的脚步要踌躇不前，他的计谋必使自己颠仆。

definition: hesitant to take action
to stand still without advancing (idiom); to hesitate and hold back
to hesitate/indecisive
variant of 踟躕|踟蹰[chi2 chu2]
to shrink back in fear (idiom); too cowardly to advance
to waver/to hesitate
hesitancy/indecision/to waver
to hesitate over what move to make (idiom); to waver/to shilly-shally
to hesitate to move forward/to balk/to jib
to tread/to tramp/to loiter/to hover around
to hesitate
at a loss (idiom)
to pace back and forth/to hesitate/to be indecisive
timidity/timid/cowardly
afraid of the head, terrified of the tail (idiom); ever fearful and nervous/afraid of the slightest thing
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
